contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|hellfire}} {{tocright}} '''Hellfire''' may refer to: * The fires of Hell or lake of fire, terms used to describe [[Hell]] ==In music== * [[Hellfire (album)|''Hellfire'' (album)]], a 2005 album by Norwegian black metal group 1349 * [[Hellfire (song)|"Hellfire" (song)]], in the 1996 Disney film ''The Hunchback of Notre Dame'' * "Hellfire", a song by Airbourne from ''[[Runnin' Wild (Airbourne album)|Runnin' Wild]]'' * Davey "Hellfire" Kelly, one-time guitarist of the [[Sonic Boom Six]] * "Hellfire", a song used in the final stage of the video game [[Soulcalibur II]] ==Films== * [[Hellfire (film)|''Hellfire'' (film)]], a 1949 western * ''Hellfire'', a TV movie produced by [[Roger Corman]] * ''[[Hellfire: A Journey from Hiroshima]]'', a 1986 documentary film ==In gaming== * ''[[Diablo: Hellfire]]'', a 1997 expansion pack to the computer game ''Diablo'' from Sierra On-Line * [[Hellfire (video game)|''Hellfire'' (video game)]], a 1989 arcade game, later ported to the [[Mega Drive]] and [[PC Engine CD-ROM]] * [[Dreadnought (Warhammer 40,000)#Variants|Hellfire Dreadnought]], a walker in the [[Warhammer 40,000]] universe ==Places== * [[Hellfire Pass]], a cutting on the World War II "Death Railway" in Thailand * "Hellfire Pass", an English colloquial name for [[Halfaya Pass]] on the north coast of Egypt ==Other== * [[AGM-114 Hellfire]], an air-to-ground missile system * "[[Hell-Fire]]", a science fiction short story by American writer Isaac Asimov * [[Hellfire trigger]], a rapid-fire firearm trigger attachment * [[Hellfire (comics)]], various characters * Hellfire, a power of the [[Ghost Rider (comics)]] ==See also== * [[Hellfire Club (disambiguation)]] * [[Lake of Fire (disambiguation)]] {{disambig}}
